page.title: 04ST. MARY'S CHURCH, HITCHIN
page.content: The present church is built on the site of a Benedictine monastery founded in 792 by King Offa of Mercia. 910.The church and adjoining palace were burnt down and the monks left for St. Albans. The people used stones from the ruins to build a parish church. 1086.Recorded as the most important church in the deanery in the Domesday survey. 1115.Partly destroyed by the 'Great Wind'. 1220.The nuns and Bishop Hugh of Lincoln endowed a vicarage. 1292. Church struck by lightning, considerable damage. 1298.Centre of church collapsed,said to be the result of an earthquake.1304 The roof fell in damaging monuments and relics. 1305.Rebuilding of the church with flint, rubble and stone from Totternhoe was completed.The church still has an important role in the community.
